title: Eni Lifts Buybacks as 2025 Profit Beats Expectations
summary:
Eni has reported a strong financial performance for the fourth quarter of 2025, exceeding market expectations with an adjusted net profit of €1.20 billion, marking a 35% increase from the previous year. This growth was driven by robust cash flow and disciplined capital allocation, despite a challenging oil price environment characterized by a 15% decline in Brent prices. The company’s full-year adjusted net profit reached €4.99 billion, reflecting a slight decrease of 5% year-on-year. Eni's operational efficiency is highlighted by an impressive hydrocarbon production average of 1.73 million barrels of oil equivalent per day (boe/d) for the year, with fourth-quarter output rising over 7% year-on-year to 1.84 million boe/d, showcasing the company's ability to adapt to market fluctuations.

The Exploration & Production segment has been pivotal in driving Eni's earnings, contributing €2.80 billion in fourth-quarter proforma adjusted EBIT. This success is attributed to higher production volumes and stringent cost management, which have effectively countered the impact of lower crude prices. Eni has also maintained a strong organic reserve replacement ratio of 167%, ensuring that it continues to replace more hydrocarbons than it extracts. The company has successfully launched six major projects across various countries, including Angola and Indonesia, which are expected to bolster its production capabilities and enhance medium-term growth prospects.

Strategically, Eni is expanding its liquefied natural gas (LNG) operations and consolidating its upstream assets in Asia. A significant agreement with Petronas aims to create a jointly controlled entity in Indonesia and Malaysia, targeting a sustainable production plateau exceeding 500,000 boe/d. Additionally, Eni has secured long-term LNG sales contracts in Turkey and Thailand, further solidifying its position in the global gas market. The company is also making strides in its transition businesses, with Plenitude expanding its renewable energy capacity to 5.8 GW, a 41% increase year-on-year, while benefiting from improved biofuel margins in Europe, indicating a positive trajectory towards sustainable energy solutions.
social_text: Eni's Q4 2025 adjusted net profit hit €1.20B (+35% YoY), with hydrocarbon production averaging 1.73M boe/d. Strategic LNG agreements with Petronas and long-term contracts in Asia bolster growth prospects.

title: China's Baidu revenue falls as AI cloud growth fails to offset ad weakness
summary:
Baidu, China's leading search engine operator, reported a 4% decline in revenue for the fourth quarter, primarily due to ongoing challenges in its advertising business. Despite a robust performance in its AI-powered cloud services, which saw revenue exceed 11 billion yuan ($1.61 billion) and accounted for 43% of total business revenue, the overall financial results fell short of expectations. The advertising sector, Baidu's main revenue source, has been adversely affected by weak consumer demand and a struggling property market, leading to reduced spending from advertisers.

The company has made significant investments in artificial intelligence, totaling over 100 billion yuan in the past three years, as it seeks to pivot towards AI-driven growth. CEO Robin Li emphasized that AI has become the new core of Baidu, with the company focusing on enhancing its cloud services and AI applications. Despite the challenges in the ad market, Baidu is committed to maintaining its investment pace in AI technologies, which are increasingly being recognized by enterprises.

In early trading, Baidu's U.S.-listed shares fell more than 4%, reflecting investor concerns over the advertising market's recovery. The company's total revenue for the quarter reached 32.74 billion yuan, slightly surpassing analysts' expectations of 32.62 billion yuan. Adjusted earnings per share stood at 10.62 yuan, indicating a need for Baidu to navigate its advertising challenges while capitalizing on its AI advancements to drive future growth.
social_text: Baidu's revenue fell 4% in Q4, driven by ad market weakness despite AI cloud growth exceeding 11 billion yuan ($1.61 billion). Total revenue reached 32.74 billion yuan, slightly above estimates, as AI becomes the core focus.

title: Hikma Pharma tumbles on softer guidance as buyback fails to soften pill
summary:
Hikma Pharmaceuticals PLC experienced a significant drop in its share price, falling nearly 16% to 1,390p following the release of its financial results for 2025. While the company reported a 7% increase in revenue, reaching £3.3 billion, its operating profit saw an 11% decline to £542 million. This decline in profit was attributed to margin pressures despite the growth in sales. The results met market expectations, but the company's guidance for 2026 was disappointing, leading to investor concerns. The anticipated revenue growth for 2026 is projected at only 2-4%, which is below the consensus estimate of 5.6%. Furthermore, the guidance for Injectables growth was also revised downwards, with expectations now set in the low single digits compared to the previously forecasted 8%. This has raised alarms among analysts and investors alike, as the company has also withdrawn its prior mid-term guidance for both Injectables and the overall business.

In a strategic shift, Hikma announced that executive chair Said Darwazah will take on the role of full-time chief executive for the next two years. Khalid Nabilsi, the current chief financial officer, will transition to deputy chief executive, focusing on North America and Europe. Meanwhile, Areb Kurdi will step in as acting chief financial officer while the company searches for a permanent replacement. This leadership change comes at a critical time as the company navigates through a challenging financial landscape and seeks to reassure investors following the disappointing guidance.

Despite the announcement of a $250 million share buyback for 2026, which typically serves to bolster investor confidence, it failed to mitigate the negative sentiment surrounding Hikma's future prospects. Analysts have expressed concerns that the company's inability to provide a reassuring outlook could lead to downgrades in earnings estimates. As the market reacts to these developments, Hikma's management will need to address the underlying issues affecting profitability and growth to regain investor trust and stabilize its stock performance moving forward.
social_text: Hikma Pharma shares plummet 16% to 1,390p after 2026 guidance disappoints with 2-4% revenue growth vs. 5.6% consensus. Operating profit down 11% to £542M amid margin pressures. $250M buyback announced.

title: Chubb Stock: Is CB Outperforming the Financial Sector?
summary:
Chubb Limited (CB), a leading global insurer based in Zurich, has demonstrated impressive stock performance, significantly outperforming the broader financial sector. With a market capitalization of approximately $132.6 billion, Chubb has established itself as a major player in the insurance industry, providing a wide range of coverage options including commercial and personal property, casualty, reinsurance, and life insurance solutions. The company's robust balance sheet enables it to underwrite specialty risks and manage catastrophe exposures effectively, ensuring long-term stability and growth in its offerings across global markets.

In recent months, Chubb's stock has shown remarkable resilience, trading just 1.1% below its February high of $338.19. Over the past three months, CB shares have surged by 12.4%, contrasting sharply with the State Street Financial Select Sector SPDR ETF (XLF), which has declined by 1.3% during the same period. This trend of outperformance is further highlighted by Chubb's 20.6% increase over the past 52 weeks, compared to a mere 1.8% rise in XLF, showcasing Chubb's sustained strength in the financial sector.

The technical indicators also support Chubb's strong fundamentals, as the stock has consistently traded above its 50-day and 200-day moving averages since November 2025. Following the release of its fourth-quarter fiscal 2025 results, which revealed a 24.7% year-over-year increase in net income to $3.2 billion and an adjusted EPS of $7.52, Chubb's stock rose by 5.1%. This performance was driven by robust growth in both property and casualty and life insurance segments, reinforcing Chubb's position as a leader in the insurance market.
social_text: Chubb Limited (CB) stock has surged 12.4% in 3 months, outperforming the XLF ETF, which fell 1.3%. With a market cap of $132.6B, CB's net income rose 24.7% to $3.2B, and adjusted EPS hit $7.52, exceeding estimates.

title: Singapore's Grab bets on AI, new services to triple profit by 2028
summary:
Grab, Southeast Asia's leading ride-hailing and delivery platform, is strategically focusing on artificial intelligence and the expansion of new services to achieve a threefold increase in profit by 2028. The company's President and COO, Alex Hungate, outlined ambitious goals for the next three years, aiming for over 20% annual revenue growth and tripling its EBITDA to $1.5 billion by 2028. This shift comes as the ride-hailing industry transitions from a phase of subsidy-driven growth to a more sustainable profitability model, amidst rising operational costs and increased competition.

The company recently reported its first full-year net profit since its inception 14 years ago, following substantial fundraising efforts. However, its projections for 2026 revenue and adjusted EBITDA fell short of Wall Street expectations, resulting in a decline in stock value. Grab's shares have dropped over 15% this year, reflecting broader challenges in the ride-hailing sector, where competitors like Uber and Lyft are also experiencing significant stock declines.

To meet its ambitious targets, Grab plans to enhance efficiency within its app and delivery network, leveraging its existing user base to bundle services like mobility, food delivery, and groceries at reduced costs. Additionally, the company is expanding its financial services, utilizing data analytics to improve loan underwriting processes, which positions it to compete more effectively against traditional banks. Despite potential risks associated with investments in AI and autonomous vehicles, Grab remains committed to its growth strategy in the rapidly evolving Southeast Asian market.
social_text: Grab aims to triple its EBITDA to $1.5 billion by 2028, focusing on AI and new services like groceries and financial products. The company targets over 20% annual revenue growth, leveraging its extensive user base for bundled services.

title: Binance bets on Greek labour, security for EU growth, co-CEO Teng says
summary:
Binance, the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange, is strategically positioning itself in Europe by applying for a regulatory license in Greece under the Markets in Crypto-Assets Regulation (MiCA). Co-CEO Richard Teng highlighted Greece's labor force and security profile as key factors that influenced their decision, despite the country not yet issuing any MiCA licenses. This move comes as Binance seeks to expand its operations in the European market, where it currently holds approximately $44 billion in bitcoin across its customer wallets. The MiCA regulation requires crypto companies to obtain a license by July 2026 to continue operating within the EU, making this application a critical step for Binance's future in the region.

Teng, who took over as co-CEO in November 2023, emphasized the importance of considering various factors beyond just regulatory compliance, such as social dynamics and the talent pool available in Greece. This unconventional choice reflects Binance's desire to establish a strong foothold in Europe, especially as it navigates a complex regulatory landscape. The exchange has previously faced scrutiny, particularly following legal challenges faced by its founder, Changpeng Zhao, who was recently pardoned after pleading guilty to violating U.S. money-laundering laws.

As Binance aims to become the most regulated crypto exchange globally, Teng's leadership will be pivotal in addressing ongoing regulatory challenges and ensuring compliance with EU standards. The decision to apply for a license in Greece, despite the presence of more established financial centers like Germany and the Netherlands, underscores Binance's commitment to finding a suitable base for its European operations. The outcome of this application will be closely watched as it could significantly impact Binance's growth trajectory in the EU market.
social_text: Binance applies for a MiCA license in Greece, aiming to leverage the local labor force and security profile. With $44B in bitcoin, it seeks to expand in Europe amid regulatory challenges and a push for compliance.

title: The new anti-AI trade sweeping Wall Street: 'HALO'
summary:
A new investment trend known as 'HALO' (Heavy Assets, Low Obsolescence) is gaining traction on Wall Street as investors seek refuge from the volatility associated with artificial intelligence advancements. This strategy focuses on companies with substantial real assets, such as energy grids, pipelines, and heavy machinery, which are perceived as less vulnerable to AI disruption. Investor Josh Brown highlighted that these HALO stocks have significantly outperformed the broader market, particularly in sectors like energy and materials, which have seen gains of over 23% and 15%, respectively, this year. In contrast, the tech sector has struggled, with only two of the 'Magnificent Seven' stocks showing positive performance amid concerns over high capital expenditures and the potential impact of AI on software companies.

The HALO trade reflects a broader market sentiment where investors are increasingly cautious about technology stocks, particularly those reliant on scalability and high fees. The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF has experienced a dramatic decline of over 22% this year, indicating a significant shift in investor confidence. As AI technologies evolve, fears surrounding their implications for traditional software businesses have led to a sell-off, further exacerbating the challenges faced by the tech sector. Meanwhile, sectors tied to tangible assets are thriving, suggesting a potential long-term shift in investment strategies as market participants reassess risk.

The adoption of the HALO concept is not limited to individual investors; institutional players are also recognizing the strategic advantages of focusing on real asset-heavy companies. A recent note from Barclays' trading desk emphasized the benefits of HALO stocks, indicating a growing consensus on their resilience in the face of technological disruption. As the market continues to navigate the complexities introduced by AI, the HALO strategy may represent a viable path for investors seeking stability and growth in an uncertain economic landscape.
social_text: The HALO trade is reshaping Wall Street, focusing on heavy asset companies like energy and materials, which have surged over 23% and 15% this year, while tech stocks struggle with a 22% decline in the iShares Expanded Tech-Software ETF.

title: Women’s wealth is expected to boom: Where they are investing and how they can maximize returns
summary:
The article discusses the significant shift in wealth dynamics as women investors are poised to gain control over a substantial portion of inherited wealth in the coming decades. With the anticipated 'Great Wealth Transfer,' Cerulli Associates projects that $105 trillion will be passed down to heirs by 2048, with women likely receiving a significant share due to their longer life expectancy. Currently, women hold $18 trillion in investable assets in the U.S., which is expected to nearly double to $34 trillion by 2030, indicating a growing influence in financial markets. Despite this positive trend, women still lag behind men in terms of investment amounts and earnings, earning only 81 cents for every dollar earned by men, as reported by the National Women's Law Center.

Stephanie Link, chief investment strategist at Hightower Advisors, emphasizes the importance of this wealth shift, stating that it will fundamentally change who controls wealth. The article highlights the need for women to become more sophisticated investors and take calculated risks to maximize their returns. Events like the upcoming CNBC Pro Live event aim to empower women investors by providing them with deeper insights into market strategies and investment opportunities.

As women increasingly take charge of their financial futures, the article underscores the importance of education and community support in bridging the gender investment gap. With the right tools and knowledge, women can leverage the wealth transfer to not only enhance their financial standing but also contribute to a more equitable investment landscape. This shift could lead to a more balanced representation in financial decision-making and investment strategies, ultimately benefiting the broader economy.
social_text: Women are set to inherit $105 trillion by 2048, with $54 trillion going to spouses. Currently, they control $18 trillion in U.S. assets, expected to rise to $34 trillion by 2030, highlighting a significant wealth shift.

title: Wall Street loves this 'AI-proof retail compounder'
summary:
TJX Cos., the parent company of Marshalls and T.J. Maxx, has garnered positive attention from Wall Street despite a mixed reaction to its latest earnings report. Both Bernstein and Bank of America have reaffirmed their bullish outlooks, with Bernstein maintaining an overweight rating and Bank of America issuing a buy rating. Following the earnings report, which showed both earnings and revenue beats, the stock experienced a decline due to weaker-than-expected guidance for the current quarter and the full year. Analysts from both firms have raised their 12-month price targets to $175, suggesting a potential upside of approximately 12% from the stock's closing price on Thursday.

Bernstein analyst Aneesha Sherman highlighted that despite the disappointing guidance, TJX's management indicated a solid performance in the early part of the quarter. Sherman emphasized that TJX's valuation, with a forward multiple of 30, has room for growth compared to its competitors like Ross Stores and Burlington Stores. In a market increasingly concerned about the impact of artificial intelligence on retail, Sherman labeled TJX as an 'AI-proof retail compounder' due to its unique offline shopping experience that encourages customers to engage in a 'treasure hunt' for deals, making it difficult for online competitors to replicate.

Bank of America analyst Lorraine Hutchinson has adjusted her earnings per share estimates for 2026 and 2027 downward, citing higher non-production operating costs. However, she remains optimistic about TJX's performance, expecting improvements throughout the year. The ongoing tariff uncertainties, particularly following the Supreme Court's recent decision regarding President Trump's tariffs, have not deterred Bank of America's confidence in TJX's ability to outperform in the retail sector. The firm believes that the ability to adjust pricing in response to tariffs has positively impacted TJX's margins, allowing the company to maintain profitability even with reduced unit sales.
social_text: Wall Street firms Bernstein and Bank of America are bullish on TJX Cos., raising price targets to $175 despite mixed earnings. Analysts call it an 'AI-proof retail compounder' due to its unique shopping model.

title: Salesforce’s underwhelming earnings won’t be enough to stem the AI software slide
summary:
Salesforce's recent fourth-quarter earnings report has left investors and analysts feeling disappointed, as the company's revenue guidance for fiscal 2027 falls short of Wall Street expectations. While Salesforce reported earnings that beat analyst predictions, the projected revenue range of $45.8 billion to $46.2 billion does not meet the anticipated $46.06 billion. This underwhelming outlook has contributed to a significant decline in Salesforce's stock, which has dropped over 25% year-to-date amidst a broader sell-off in the software sector driven by concerns over artificial intelligence disruptions.

Despite a slight uptick in stock price following the earnings release, Salesforce's shares have faced volatility, reflecting investor skepticism about the company's growth prospects. The iShares Expanded Tech-Software Sector ETF has also seen a decline of 22% this year, indicating a challenging environment for software companies. Analysts are particularly concerned about Salesforce's Agentforce platform, which utilizes AI to enhance customer service. Although the platform's annualized revenue surpassed $800 million, its contribution remains minimal compared to the overall revenue, raising doubts about its potential to drive significant growth in the near future.

Analysts from Bernstein and UBS have expressed caution regarding Salesforce's future performance. Bernstein's Mark Moerdler highlighted the maturity of Salesforce's core business and the slow adoption of Agentforce, suggesting limited upside and considerable downside risks. Meanwhile, UBS's Karl Keirstead pointed out that the majority of Salesforce's revenue is under pressure, with Agentforce only accounting for about 2% of total revenues. This situation underscores the challenges Salesforce faces in a competitive market, where innovation and rapid adaptation to AI trends are crucial for sustaining growth.
social_text: Salesforce's Q4 earnings fell short, projecting $45.8B-$46.2B for FY2027, below Wall Street's $46.06B. Shares down 25% YTD amid AI concerns, with Agentforce revenue at $800M but only 2% of total revenue.

title: AI music generator Suno hits 2M paid subscribers and $300M in annual recurring revenue
summary:
Suno, an AI music generator co-founded by CEO Mikey Shulman, has achieved significant milestones by reaching 2 million paid subscribers and generating $300 million in annual recurring revenue. This rapid growth follows a $250 million funding round that valued the company at $2.45 billion just three months prior. The impressive increase in revenue from $200 million to $300 million within a short period highlights the rising demand for AI-driven music creation tools that allow users to generate music effortlessly using natural language prompts.

The platform has sparked controversy within the music industry, particularly among musicians and record labels concerned about copyright infringement. Lawsuits have been filed against Suno, alleging that its AI model was trained on existing recorded music without proper licensing. However, a recent settlement with Warner Music Group has allowed Suno to use licensed music from its catalog, paving the way for further innovation and collaboration in the AI music space.

Suno's technology has already produced synthetic music that competes with traditional artists, as evidenced by the success of users like Telisha Jones, who transformed her poetry into a viral R&B hit and secured a record deal worth $3 million. Despite the excitement surrounding AI music generation, many prominent artists, including Billie Eilish and Katy Perry, have voiced their concerns about the implications of AI in the creative process, indicating a complex landscape ahead for the industry.
social_text: Suno's AI music generator hits 2M paid subscribers and $300M ARR, up from $200M in just three months. Warner Music settles, allowing licensed music use. Artists like Billie Eilish voice concerns over AI's impact on music.

title: Apple and Netflix team up to air Formula 1 Canadian Grand Prix
summary:
Apple and Netflix have announced a groundbreaking partnership to co-broadcast the Formula 1 Canadian Grand Prix, marking a significant development in the way sports content is delivered to fans. This collaboration allows F1 enthusiasts in the U.S. to watch the live race on both Apple TV and Netflix simultaneously, enhancing accessibility for viewers. The event is scheduled for May 24, and subscribers will have the opportunity to stream the entire race weekend, which includes practice sessions, qualifying rounds, and the Grand Prix itself. This initiative is expected to attract a larger audience and elevate the profile of Formula 1 in the American market.

In addition to live race coverage, the partnership will promote Netflix's popular series, "Drive to Survive," which has played a crucial role in popularizing F1 in the U.S. The eighth season of the series, featuring eight episodes that cover the 2025 Formula One World Championship, will be available to both Apple TV and Netflix users, significantly broadening its reach. The series has transformed the perception of motorsport documentaries, drawing in millions of new fans with its engaging storytelling and behind-the-scenes insights.

This collaboration is part of Apple’s larger strategy to integrate Formula 1 into its ecosystem, with plans to promote the sport across various platforms, including Apple News, Apple Maps, Apple Music, and Apple Fitness+. Meanwhile, Netflix continues to expand its footprint in live sports broadcasting, having recently secured rights for NFL Christmas games and other major sporting events. This partnership not only signifies a shift in how sports content is consumed but also highlights the growing intersection of technology and entertainment in the sports industry.
social_text: Apple and Netflix's partnership allows U.S. fans to stream the Formula 1 Canadian Grand Prix live on both platforms. The collaboration also promotes the eighth season of 'Drive to Survive,' expanding its audience significantly.

title: Lyten acquires Northvolt’s Swedish battery assets
summary:
Lyten, a US-based battery company, has successfully acquired Northvolt's battery manufacturing and research assets in Sweden, marking a significant expansion in its operations. This acquisition includes Northvolt Ett and its expansion in Skellefteå, as well as Northvolt Labs in Västerås, with a combined book value of approximately $5 billion. The facilities boast an impressive 16GWh of existing cell production capacity and encompass over 160 hectares of land, making it a pivotal site for battery research and development in Europe. This strategic move comes in the wake of Northvolt's bankruptcy filing in March due to financial and operational difficulties, allowing Lyten to capitalize on the existing infrastructure and talent in the region.

With the acquisition, Lyten plans to restart production at the Skellefteå plant, with commercial battery cell shipments anticipated in the latter half of 2026. Northvolt Ett will focus on manufacturing lithium-ion nickel, manganese, and cobalt (NMC) cells, which are essential for battery energy storage systems and automotive applications. These cells will supply Lyten's battery energy storage system assembly facility in Gdansk, Poland. Additionally, Northvolt Labs will continue its development of long-life lithium-ion NMC cells while collaborating with Lyten's Silicon Valley operations to industrialize lithium-sulphur battery technology for large-scale production.

Lyten's CEO, Dan Cook, emphasized the strategic importance of this acquisition, stating that it positions Lyten as a key player in the European battery manufacturing landscape. The company aims to build a robust battery ecosystem across North America and Europe, leveraging local supply chains and talent to meet the increasing global demand for distributed electricity infrastructure. As part of this transition, Lyten has initiated a rehiring program in Skellefteå and Västerås, signaling its commitment to revitalizing the workforce and operations at these critical sites.
social_text: Lyten acquires Northvolt's Swedish battery assets valued at $5bn, including 16GWh production capacity and Europe's largest battery R&D center, aiming for commercial shipments by 2026.

title: Why Compass and Rocket say their partnership is the remedy for high home prices
summary:
Compass and Rocket have formed a strategic partnership aimed at addressing the ongoing housing affordability crisis by increasing the availability of home listings. The collaboration focuses on leveraging Compass's 'Private Exclusives' and 'Coming Soon' properties, which will be integrated directly onto Rocket's Redfin platform. This innovative approach is expected to unlock up to 500,000 new listings, providing much-needed inventory to a market that has been struggling with scarcity. Rocket's CEO, Varun Krishna, emphasizes the importance of creating more options for sellers, thereby lowering barriers for potential buyers, particularly among younger generations who are disproportionately affected by high housing costs.

The partnership comes at a critical time when a significant portion of younger demographics, including 67% of Gen Z and 53% of millennials, report difficulties in managing housing payments. By enhancing inventory availability, Compass and Rocket aim to alleviate some of the financial pressures faced by these groups. While the partnership is framed as a consumer-focused initiative, analysts suggest that it also serves to bolster market share for both companies, with Rocket's stock rising approximately 40% over the past year, reflecting investor confidence in the venture.

Market analysts, including BTIG's Eric Hagen, have expressed optimism regarding the potential synergies from Rocket's recent merger, projecting $500 million in benefits that could be realized sooner than expected. This partnership not only seeks to improve housing accessibility but also positions both companies favorably within the competitive real estate landscape, as they capitalize on technological advancements and strategic market positioning to drive growth in housing activity.
social_text: Compass and Rocket's new partnership aims to unlock 500,000 listings to combat housing affordability, targeting younger buyers. Rocket's stock surged 40% as analysts predict $500M in synergies from their merger ahead of schedule.

title: How Trump's 'One Big Beautiful Bill' could force some older workers to delay retirement — ways to protect your savings
summary:
President Trump's 'One Big Beautiful Bill' introduces significant changes to Medicaid and SNAP that could impact older workers' retirement plans. The new legislation mandates work requirements for individuals aged 19 to 64, necessitating that they complete 80 hours of work, job training, or community service monthly to maintain access to essential benefits. This shift marks a departure from previous federal law, which prohibited such requirements, although some states had already implemented their own rules. States have until January 1, 2027, to comply with these new mandates, which primarily affect those enrolled in the Affordable Care Act Medicaid expansion.

The implications of these changes are particularly concerning for individuals nearing retirement, as they may be forced to delay their exit from the workforce to retain access to health care and food assistance. For those aged 55 to 64, the SNAP program now requires similar work commitments, further complicating financial planning for retirement. Adults in this age group must work at least 80 hours a month or risk losing their benefits, which could lead to a precarious financial situation for many.

As a result, older workers must reassess their retirement strategies in light of these new requirements. Those who retire before age 65 may face challenges in securing health insurance and may need to adjust their Social Security benefits application timing. It is crucial for individuals to stay informed about these changes and consider their options to protect their savings and ensure a stable transition into retirement amidst evolving eligibility rules.
social_text: Trump's new bill mandates work for Medicaid and SNAP, requiring adults 19-64 to work 80 hours/month, impacting retirement plans for those under 65. States must comply by Jan 1, 2027, affecting financial stability for many.

title: Payday loan alternatives that could save you money
summary:
Payday loans are notorious for their exorbitant interest rates, often exceeding 300%, which can trap borrowers in a cycle of debt. In contrast, personal loans offer a more manageable alternative, allowing borrowers at least a year to repay the amount borrowed. The Bankrate team has evaluated various personal loan lenders, highlighting options that cater to different credit profiles, including those with flexible eligibility requirements and extended loan terms of up to seven years. This makes personal loans a viable choice for individuals facing financial difficulties, provided they have a good credit score, typically around 700, which can secure an annual percentage rate of approximately 12%. 

For those with bad credit, personal loans are still accessible, albeit at higher interest rates that can reach up to 36% for unsecured loans. Borrowers should also be cautious of origination fees that may diminish the actual funds received. While personal loans can be used for various purposes, including essential expenses like groceries and bills, it is crucial to evaluate the pros and cons before committing to any loan product. 

In light of the predatory nature of payday loans, which are illegal in 25 states, it is essential for borrowers to consider safer alternatives. Many lenders now offer bad credit loans that are not only easier to repay but also provide quicker access to funds, often within the same or next day. Ultimately, individuals should assess their financial situation carefully and explore all available options to avoid the pitfalls associated with high-interest payday loans.
social_text: Payday loans can exceed 300% interest, trapping borrowers in debt. Personal loans offer better terms, with rates around 12% for good credit. Explore safer options to avoid predatory lending practices.

title: Oppenheimer predicts the global drone market will be worth $400 billion in a decade. How to play it
summary:
Oppenheimer has identified drones as a pivotal investment opportunity within the burgeoning field of physical artificial intelligence, projecting the global drone market to escalate from $45 billion to an astounding $400 billion over the next decade. This growth is largely attributed to the escalating geopolitical tensions and military investments, highlighted by the U.S. House of Representatives' authorization of a $900.6 billion budget for the Defense Department in fiscal 2026. Drones are at the forefront of this transformation, revolutionizing warfare and potentially influencing various commercial sectors as well.

The report emphasizes that the anticipated market expansion will be driven by advancements in drone hardware, services, artificial intelligence, and associated software. Oppenheimer's analysts predict that the future landscape will be dominated by unmanned drones, robots, and autonomous systems, which will operate either remotely or autonomously. This shift is expected to catalyze a

title: Josh Brown likes this trash and recycling management giant that's within striking distance of a record
summary:
Josh Brown and Sean Russo of Ritholtz Wealth Management highlight Waste Management (WM) as a compelling investment opportunity, particularly due to its strong financial performance and strategic positioning. Bill Gates, through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation Trust, holds approximately 28.9 million shares, making it the largest individual shareholder. Waste Management operates in a unique space, providing essential waste collection and landfill services, which are characterized by contracted revenue streams and price escalators. With over $20 billion in annual revenue and a consistent history of dividend increases spanning more than two decades, WM demonstrates resilience and reliability in its financials.

The company has undergone a significant reinvestment cycle, focusing on modernizing its equipment and enhancing automation capabilities. This strategic move is expected to yield substantial returns in the near future, as the investments made during the 'planting years' begin to pay off. Waste Management's management team has emphasized the importance of this transition, which aims to establish a higher-margin business model that can withstand economic fluctuations.

As Waste Management approaches its 52-week highs, the narrative surrounding its capital expenditures and operational improvements becomes increasingly relevant. Investors are encouraged to consider WM not just as a waste management company, but as a robust investment that balances the tech-heavy portfolio of investors like Gates with its low-obsolescence, cash-generating capabilities. The combination of a strong dividend history, strategic investments, and a unique market position makes Waste Management a noteworthy stock in today's market landscape.
social_text: Bill Gates holds 28.9M shares of Waste Management (WM), making it the largest individual shareholder. WM generates $20B+ in revenue, $5B+ EBITDA, and has a 20-year dividend increase streak, positioning it as a resilient investment.

title: The 'Buffett Indicator' shows the market is way overvalued. How to hedge risk with this options strategy
summary:
The 'Buffett Indicator', a metric popularized by Warren Buffett, measures the ratio of U.S. stock market capitalization to GDP, and it currently suggests that the market is significantly overvalued. As of the latest data, this ratio stands at approximately 2.3x, a stark contrast to the historical average of around 1:1 noted in 2001. This dramatic increase in valuation is particularly concerning given that the market capitalization of the five largest U.S. companies alone exceeds $17.5 trillion, which is comparable to the entire U.S. GDP from twelve years ago. The top 25 companies in the S&P 500 now have a combined market cap of $32 trillion, surpassing the current GDP, which raises alarms about potential market corrections.

Historically, the relationship between market capitalization and GDP has shown a growing trend, with large companies increasingly dominating the economic landscape. From 1980 to 1996, the share of the economy represented by the largest publicly traded companies grew from approximately 40% to 75%. Although the tech bubble and the 2008 financial crisis disrupted this trend, the market has rebounded and returned to a similar trajectory. Just before the pandemic, U.S. equities were valued at around 140% of GDP, aligning with the long-term trend of large companies capturing a larger share of the economy.

Investors are advised to approach the current market conditions with caution. While the high market-cap-to-GDP ratio raises concerns about overvaluation, it is essential to consider the historical context and the ongoing trend of large companies' dominance in the economy. Instead of panic selling, investors might explore hedging strategies, such as options, to mitigate risk while navigating this potentially volatile market environment. Understanding these dynamics can help investors make informed decisions in the face of uncertainty.
social_text: The Buffett Indicator shows U.S. equities at a 2.3x market-cap-to-GDP ratio, significantly above historical norms. The top 25 S&P 500 companies have a combined market cap of $32 trillion, exceeding current GDP. Consider hedging strategies.

title: Perplexity’s new Computer is another bet that users need many AI models
summary:
Perplexity has introduced a new tool called Perplexity Computer, designed to unify various AI capabilities into a single, agentic system. This innovative tool allows users to execute complex workflows independently by utilizing 19 different AI models. It can even create subagents to tackle specific problems, enhancing its versatility. Currently, the tool is available exclusively to subscribers of the Perplexity Max plan, which costs $200 per month. By operating entirely in the cloud, Perplexity Computer aims to mitigate some security concerns associated with other agentic tools in the market.

Despite the excitement surrounding its launch, Perplexity faced challenges leading up to the product demonstration, which was canceled due to flaws discovered shortly before the event. This incident highlights the ongoing development and refinement process that the company is undergoing as it strives to maintain its competitive edge in the rapidly evolving AI landscape. Perplexity has previously gained attention for its user-friendly interfaces and innovative products, such as its Comet web browser, but it now faces increased competition from major players like Google.

The company is adapting to a changing ecosystem, having recently abandoned its advertising model to restore user trust in the accuracy of its answers. While Perplexity boasts a user base in the tens of millions, it remains significantly smaller than OpenAI, which claims 800 million weekly users. As Perplexity continues to innovate and refine its offerings, it aims to carve out a distinct niche in the crowded AI market, focusing on delivering reliable and comprehensive solutions for its subscribers.
social_text: Perplexity Computer launches for $200/month, integrating 19 AI models for complex workflows. Despite a canceled demo due to flaws, it aims to redefine user experience in AI, competing against giants like Google.

title: ‘Pokémon Winds and Waves’ are coming to the Nintendo Switch 2 in 2027
summary:
The Pokémon Company has announced the upcoming release of 'Pokémon Winds and Waves' for the Nintendo Switch 2, set to launch in 2027. This marks the tenth installment in the beloved franchise, celebrating thirty years since the original Pokémon games were released. The new game promises an open-world experience, allowing players to explore a vast ocean filled with islands, which is a significant evolution in gameplay style for the series. The announcement was made during a livestream event, highlighting the franchise's rich history and its commitment to innovation.

Three new starter Pokémon were introduced: Browt, a grass-type resembling a 'bean chick'; Pombon, a fire-type inspired by a Pomeranian; and Gecqua, a water-type gecko. These new characters are expected to resonate with fans, adding fresh dynamics to gameplay. Speculation suggests that the game will be set in a region inspired by Indonesia and Southeast Asia, as hinted by lush jungles and tropical landscapes showcased in the trailer. This setting could provide a unique backdrop for adventures, reminiscent of the tropical themes explored in previous titles like 'Sun and Moon'.

The anticipation for 'Pokémon Winds and Waves' is palpable, especially following the mixed reception of 'Pokémon Scarlet and Violet', which faced criticism for technical issues. The extended development time until its release in November 2027 is seen as a positive sign, allowing developers to refine the game and enhance the overall player experience. Until then, fans can enjoy reissues of classic titles like 'Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen', although at a price point of $20. The excitement surrounding the new game indicates that the Pokémon franchise continues to evolve while maintaining its core appeal to fans worldwide.
social_text: Pokémon Winds and Waves, the 10th main series game, launches in 2027 on Nintendo Switch 2. Explore a vast ocean of islands with new starters Browt, Pombon, and Gecqua. Anticipation builds as fans await a refined experience.

title: Block shares soar as Dorsey leans on AI to trim workforce
summary:
Block Inc., the fintech company co-founded by Jack Dorsey, has announced a significant restructuring that will see its workforce nearly halved, leading to a surge in its stock price by over 16%. This decision comes as part of a strategic shift to integrate artificial intelligence tools across its operations, reflecting a broader trend in the industry where companies are increasingly leveraging AI to enhance efficiency and reduce costs. Dorsey emphasized that many firms are lagging in recognizing the transformative potential of AI, which is reshaping how businesses operate and compete in the digital landscape.

The layoffs, while drastic, are viewed by analysts as a necessary step to improve operational margins and free cash flow (FCF). Evercore ISI analysts noted that this move is not merely about cutting jobs but rather about reallocating resources to achieve higher returns on investments. Goldman Sachs economists have projected that AI could lead to significant job losses in the coming years, with estimates suggesting a reduction of 5,000 to 10,000 jobs monthly in sectors most susceptible to automation by 2025.

Despite the immediate positive impact on Block's stock and margins, the long-term implications of such a drastic workforce reduction remain uncertain. Analysts from Morningstar have cautioned that while the decision may enhance margins in the short term, sustaining these gains will be challenging. Block's adjusted operating margin is projected to rise to 26% this year, up from 20% in 2025, indicating a potential turnaround for the company as it navigates the competitive landscape of digital payments and online commerce.
social_text: Block Inc. shares surged 16% after announcing a workforce reduction of nearly 50% to integrate AI tools, aiming for a 26% operating margin in 2025, up from 20%. Analysts warn of uncertain long-term impacts on productivity and job growth.

ESAB Corporation, a prominent player in the welding and cutting industry, has a market capitalization of $7.76 billion and reported a revenue of $2.84 billion for the trailing twelve months. The company specializes in providing a wide range of products, including welding consumables, cutting equipment, and digital solutions tailored for industrial fabrication and gas control. title: How much can I borrow with a personal loan if I have bad credit?
summary:
Individuals with bad credit often face significant challenges when seeking personal loans, as lenders perceive them as higher risk. According to the Q3 2025 TransUnion Report, borrowers with FICO scores below 600 typically secure loans averaging around $1,800, while those with scores between 601 and 660 can expect about $4,500. This disparity highlights the importance of credit scores in determining loan eligibility and amounts. Lenders also evaluate factors such as credit history, current debts, and income, which further influence the loan amounts offered to borrowers.

For those with poor credit, the average unsecured loan amount is under $2,000, making it crucial for borrowers to shop around for the best rates. Higher interest rates associated with bad credit loans can lead to costly monthly payments, even for smaller loan amounts. To improve their chances of securing larger loans, borrowers can consider adding a cosigner or co-borrower with better credit, or demonstrating a healthy debt-to-income ratio.

Ultimately, understanding the factors that affect loan amounts is vital for borrowers with bad credit. By improving their credit scores through responsible financial management or obtaining a personal loan, individuals may increase their borrowing potential over time. This knowledge empowers borrowers to make informed decisions and navigate the lending landscape more effectively, potentially leading to better financial outcomes in the future.
social_text: Borrowers with bad credit (FICO <600) average $1,800 in personal loans, while those with scores 601-660 average $4,500. Higher rates make shopping for loans essential for better terms and amounts.

title: The average amount in U.S. savings accounts – how does your cash stack up?
summary:
The latest data from the Federal Reserve's Survey of Consumer Finances (SCF) reveals significant insights into the average savings account balances of U.S. households. The median balance stands at $8,000, which provides a more realistic view of typical savings compared to the average balance of $62,410. This discrepancy highlights the influence of high outliers on the average figure, suggesting that many households may struggle to save effectively. The SCF data also indicates that savings vary considerably by household type, with couples without children holding the highest median balances, while single parents tend to have the lowest. 

Income levels play a crucial role in determining savings, with the top income bracket (earning over $245,400) boasting a median balance of $111,600, in stark contrast to the lowest bracket, which averages only $900. Age also significantly impacts savings, as younger individuals under 35 average $20,540, while those aged 65-74 have a peak average of $100,250 in their transaction accounts. This age-related disparity underscores the importance of early financial planning and the accumulation of savings over time.

Despite the potential benefits of high-yield savings accounts and certificates of deposit (CDs), many Americans face challenges in building their savings. With only 46% of U.S. adults having sufficient emergency savings to cover three months of expenses, the data emphasizes the need for improved financial literacy and savings strategies. As interest rates on savings accounts have declined, it remains essential for individuals to seek out the best options available to ensure their savings grow and remain resilient against inflation and economic uncertainties.
social_text: The median U.S. household savings balance is $8,000, while the average is $62,410. Only 46% of adults can cover three months of expenses, highlighting the need for better savings strategies amid economic uncertainty.

title: RLJ Lodging (RLJ) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary:

The fourth quarter marked the culmination of a productive year, highlighted by successful conversions and advancements in the company's development pipeline, including the Boston conversion project.

title: A Palantir options trade to play a potential buying opportunity while defining risk
summary:
The ongoing conflict between Anthropic and the U.S. Department of Defense (DoD) has opened a potential opportunity for Palantir Technologies. Anthropic's refusal to remove safeguards from its AI model, Claude, for military applications has led the DoD to seek alternatives, including Palantir, OpenAI, and Google. This situation could result in Palantir securing more government contracts, enhancing its position as a key infrastructure provider for the U.S. military. CEO Alex Karp's strong support for military applications contrasts sharply with Anthropic's approach, positioning Palantir favorably in this competitive landscape.

Despite the potential for increased government contracts, Palantir's growth strategy is not solely reliant on defense. The company is also focusing on expanding its commercial operations, which could provide a more stable revenue stream. The current market conditions, including a drawdown in Palantir's stock price, suggest that it may be an opportune time for investors to consider entering the market. The ongoing negotiations between the DoD and Anthropic could still yield a resolution, but the uncertainty presents a unique buying opportunity for investors willing to navigate the risks.

To capitalize on this situation, an investor is considering a multi-legged options strategy to define risk while taking advantage of the potential upside in Palantir's stock. The proposed trade involves selling a put spread and buying a call option, allowing for defined downside exposure while capturing unlimited upside potential above a certain price point. This strategic approach not only mitigates risk but also positions the investor to benefit from any positive developments in Palantir's relationship with the DoD and its overall market performance.
social_text: With Anthropic's military AI model in dispute, Palantir could gain DoD contracts. A strategic options trade involves selling a put spread and buying a call, costing $350, with upside potential above $143.50.

title: Employees at Google and OpenAI support Anthropic’s Pentagon stand in open letter
summary:
In a significant move reflecting the ethical concerns surrounding artificial intelligence, over 300 employees from Google and more than 60 from OpenAI have signed an open letter supporting Anthropic's stance against the Pentagon's demands for unrestricted access to its AI technology. The letter emphasizes the importance of maintaining ethical boundaries in the development and deployment of AI, particularly in relation to domestic mass surveillance and autonomous weaponry. The signatories urge their companies to unite in opposition to the military's requests, highlighting the potential dangers of compromising on these critical issues.

The letter articulates a clear message: the tech industry must collectively resist pressures that could lead to the misuse of AI technologies. The signatories express their hope that leaders at Google and OpenAI will prioritize ethical considerations over competitive tensions, thereby reinforcing the boundaries that Anthropic has established. This collective action underscores a growing awareness among tech employees about the implications of their work and the moral responsibilities that come with it.

As the deadline set by the Pentagon looms, the response from Google and OpenAI remains to be seen. However, informal comments from leadership suggest a level of sympathy towards Anthropic's position. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has publicly stated his opposition to the Pentagon's threats, indicating a potential alignment with Anthropic's red lines. This situation highlights the ongoing debate within the tech community regarding the ethical use of AI and the responsibilities of companies in safeguarding against its misuse.
social_text: Over 360 employees from Google and OpenAI signed a letter supporting Anthropic's refusal to comply with Pentagon demands for AI access, emphasizing ethical boundaries against mass surveillance and autonomous weapons.

title: CISA replaces acting director after a bumbling year on the job
summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has undergone a significant leadership change following a challenging year marked by budget cuts and operational difficulties. Madhu Gottumukkala, who served as the acting director, has been replaced by Nick Andersen after a tenure that was marred by several controversies, including the mishandling of sensitive information and a significant reduction in staffing. Under Gottumukkala's leadership, CISA faced a one-third reduction in its workforce, which severely impacted its ability to fulfill its mission of protecting the nation's cybersecurity infrastructure.

Gottumukkala's leadership was further scrutinized after reports surfaced that he uploaded sensitive government documents to ChatGPT, raising serious concerns about data security and management within the agency. His tenure also included personal setbacks, such as failing a counterintelligence polygraph test, which led to the suspension of several key officials, including the agency's chief security officer. Despite these challenges, a CISA spokesperson defended Gottumukkala's performance, claiming he had done a 'remarkable job' during his time in office.

Nick Andersen, who has been appointed as the new acting director, brings experience from his previous role overseeing CISA's cybersecurity division. His appointment signals a potential shift in leadership style and strategy as the agency seeks to recover from the tumultuous period under Gottumukkala. The changes at CISA come at a critical time when the agency is tasked with enhancing the cybersecurity posture of federal systems amidst increasing threats and vulnerabilities in the digital landscape.
social_text: CISA has replaced acting director Madhu Gottumukkala after a tumultuous year marked by a one-third staff cut and security mishaps, including sensitive data mishandling. Nick Andersen steps in as acting director, aiming to stabilize the agency.

summary:

The company focuses on developing innovative oral therapeutics aimed at addressing chronic diseases, particularly type-2 diabetes and obesity, through its lead candidate GSBR-1290. With a strong emphasis on G-protein-coupled receptor (GPCR) drug discovery, Structure Therapeutics is strategically positioned to meet the growing demand for effective treatments in the biopharmaceutical landscape.

Despite the impressive stock performance, the company remains in the clinical trial phase, and revenue generation is not yet realized. Structure Therapeutics operates on a biopharmaceutical model that emphasizes drug development and potential partnerships for commercialization. This sale resulted in a shift of $38.18 million in the quarter-end position value, highlighting the dynamic nature of investment strategies in response to market movements. As Structure Therapeutics continues to advance its clinical programs, its performance will be closely monitored by investors and analysts alike, given the potential impact on the biopharmaceutical market.

title: Duolingo shares drop sharply on guidance miss
summary:
Duolingo Inc. (NASDAQ:DUOL) experienced a significant drop in its stock price, falling nearly 15% despite reporting better-than-expected quarterly earnings. In the fourth quarter of 2025, the company achieved a revenue of $282.9 million, marking a 35% increase year-over-year and surpassing analyst expectations of $275.9 million. Earnings per share also exceeded forecasts, coming in at $0.91 compared to the anticipated $0.78. The company’s adjusted EBITDA of $84.35 million and operating margin of 15.4% further highlighted its financial strength, showcasing improvements from the previous year’s figures. Additionally, Duolingo reported a substantial increase in user engagement, with 133.1 million monthly active users and 52.7 million daily active users, alongside a 28% rise in paid subscribers to 12.2 million.

Despite these positive results, investor sentiment was negatively impacted by the company's guidance for the upcoming quarters. Duolingo projected first-quarter revenue for 2026 at $288.5 million, which fell short of the $291.2 million expected by analysts. Furthermore, the full-year adjusted EBITDA forecast of $302 million was significantly below the anticipated $385 million. This cautious outlook overshadowed the strong performance metrics and growth in user base, leading to a sharp decline in share prices. CEO Luis von Ahn expressed optimism about the company's momentum, noting the achievement of over 50 million daily active users and more than $1 billion in bookings for the first time.

The mixed results highlight the challenges Duolingo faces in maintaining investor confidence amid strong operational performance. While the company has shown remarkable growth in user engagement and financial metrics, the lower-than-expected guidance raises concerns about future performance. Investors will be closely monitoring Duolingo's ability to meet its projections and sustain its growth trajectory in a competitive landscape, as the company navigates the balance between current successes and future expectations.
social_text: Duolingo reported Q4 2025 revenue of $282.9M (+35% YoY) and EPS of $0.91, but shares fell 15% due to Q1 2026 guidance of $288.5M, below $291.2M expected. Adjusted EBITDA forecast at $302M vs. $385M anticipated.

title: How to calculate interest on a car loan
summary:
Calculating interest on a car loan is essential for understanding the total cost of vehicle ownership. Online auto loan calculators simplify this process, allowing potential buyers to quickly assess how different loan amounts, terms, and interest rates affect their monthly payments and overall interest charges. These tools eliminate the need for manual calculations, making it easier for consumers to make informed financial decisions. Additionally, working directly with lenders can provide personalized calculations based on individual financial situations.

Most auto loans are structured as simple interest loans, where the interest is calculated on the remaining principal balance each month. This means that as borrowers make payments, the interest portion decreases while the principal portion increases, ultimately leading to a payoff of the loan. However, some lenders may offer precomputed interest loans, which frontload interest costs, resulting in higher initial payments that do not decrease significantly with early repayment.

Understanding the factors that influence interest rates is crucial for borrowers. Lenders assess credit scores, debt-to-income ratios, loan amounts, and repayment terms to determine the interest rate offered. A higher interest rate not only increases monthly payments but also significantly raises the total cost of the loan over its duration. By mastering the calculations involved in auto loan interest, consumers can better navigate their financing options and select loans that align with their budgets and financial goals.
social_text: Auto loan interest impacts monthly payments and total ownership costs. Simple interest loans decrease interest payments over time, while precomputed loans frontload costs. Know your credit score and terms to secure favorable rates.

title: Optimist Fund Sold Monday.com Ltd. (MNDY) Amid Forecast Discrepancies
summary:
In its fourth-quarter 2025 investor letter, Optimist Fund reported a decline of 8.5% in its portfolio, emphasizing a long-term investment strategy despite short-term challenges. A significant focus of the letter was on Monday.com Ltd. (NASDAQ:MNDY), a company that has experienced a dramatic decline in its stock value, losing 75.54% over the past year. The Fund's decision to sell its shares in Monday.com reflects a strategic move in response to these discrepancies in performance and outlook.

The letter also highlighted the competitive landscape for Monday.com, noting that it is not among the top 30 most popular stocks among hedge funds, with a decrease in hedge fund interest from 55 to 51 portfolios. This decline in popularity, combined with the company's recent performance issues, has prompted the Optimist Fund to reassess its investment in Monday.com, indicating a cautious approach to future investments in the tech sector as it seeks to optimize its portfolio for better long-term returns.
